characteristics.name: Dramatic light contrasts (chiaroscuro)
characteristics.description: Baroque art often features stark contrasts between light and dark, creating a dramatic and theatrical effect that highlights the emotional intensity of the scene.

characteristics.name: Emotional intensity
characteristics.description: Baroque artists aimed to evoke strong emotions in the viewer, often depicting scenes of intense drama, passion, and movement.

characteristics.name: Dynamic compositions
characteristics.description: Baroque compositions are characterized by their sense of movement and energy, with swirling lines and complex arrangements that draw the viewer's eye through the artwork.

characteristics.name: Symmetry, harmony, idealized human forms
characteristics.description: Renaissance art emphasizes balance and proportion, often depicting the human body in an idealized, harmonious way that reflects classical ideals of beauty.

characteristics.name: Architectural details
characteristics.description: Renaissance artists often included detailed architectural elements in their works, drawing inspiration from classical Greek and Roman structures.

characteristics.name: Linear perspective to create depth and spatial realism
characteristics.description: The use of linear perspective allowed Renaissance artists to create a sense of depth and three-dimensionality in their paintings, making the scenes appear more realistic.

characteristics.name: Detailed natural landscapes
characteristics.description: Northern Renaissance artists were known for their meticulous attention to detail, particularly in their depictions of natural landscapes and everyday life.

characteristics.name: Moral allegory and rich symbolism
characteristics.description: Many Northern Renaissance works contain layers of symbolism and moral messages, often conveyed through intricate details and hidden meanings.

characteristics.name: Used oil paints to create rich textures and vibrant colors
characteristics.description: The use of oil paints allowed Northern Renaissance artists to achieve a high level of detail and vibrant color in their works, enhancing the overall realism.

characteristics.name: Detailed domestic scenes
characteristics.description: Dutch Golden Age artists often focused on scenes of everyday life, capturing the beauty and complexity of ordinary moments with great detail.

characteristics.name: Warm natural lighting
characteristics.description: These artists skillfully used light to create a warm, inviting atmosphere in their paintings, often highlighting the textures and details of the scene.

characteristics.name: Focus on everyday life
characteristics.description: The art of the Dutch Golden Age often celebrated the simplicity and beauty of daily life, depicting scenes of domesticity, work, and leisure.

characteristics.name: Intricate botanical details
characteristics.description: Pre-Raphaelite artists paid close attention to the natural world, often including detailed and accurate depictions of plants and flowers in their works.

characteristics.name: Vibrant colors
characteristics.description: The use of bright, vivid colors is a hallmark of Pre-Raphaelite art, creating a sense of richness and intensity.

characteristics.name: Emphasis on beauty and purity
characteristics.description: Pre-Raphaelite works often idealize beauty and purity, depicting subjects with a sense of innocence and grace.

characteristics.name: Emotion-driven
characteristics.description: Romanticism is characterized by its focus on emotion and individual experience, often depicting scenes of intense passion, drama, and personal struggle.

characteristics.name: Dramatic landscapes
characteristics.description: Romantic artists frequently painted dramatic, awe-inspiring landscapes that evoke a sense of the sublime and the power of nature.

characteristics.name: Contrasts between light and shadow
characteristics.description: The use of light and shadow in Romantic art enhances the emotional impact of the scene, creating a sense of depth and drama.

characteristics.name: Clean lines
characteristics.description: Neoclassical art is characterized by its clear, precise lines and orderly compositions, reflecting the influence of classical Greek and Roman art.

characteristics.name: Symmetrical composition
characteristics.description: Neoclassical works often feature balanced, symmetrical arrangements that convey a sense of order and harmony.

characteristics.name: Emphasis on moral clarity and virtue
characteristics.description: Neoclassical artists aimed to convey moral messages and ideals of virtue, often depicting scenes from classical mythology or history.

characteristics.name: Contrasts between light and shadow
characteristics.description: The use of light and shadow in Romantic art enhances the emotional impact of the scene, creating a sense of depth and drama.

characteristics.name: Clean lines
characteristics.description: Neoclassical art is characterized by its clear, precise lines and orderly compositions, reflecting the influence of classical Greek and Roman art.

characteristics.name: Symmetrical composition
characteristics.description: Neoclassical works often feature balanced, symmetrical arrangements that convey a sense of order and harmony.

characteristics.name: Emphasis on moral clarity and virtue
characteristics.description: Neoclassical artists aimed to convey moral messages and ideals of virtue, often depicting scenes from classical mythology or history.

characteristics.name: Vibrant, atmospheric light
characteristics.description: Venetian Renaissance artists are celebrated for their masterful use of light to create a sense of atmosphere and depth.

characteristics.name: Harmonious compositions
characteristics.description: The balanced, harmonious arrangements in Venetian Renaissance works reflect the influence of classical ideals.

characteristics.name: Blending natural beauty with divine themes
characteristics.description: Venetian Renaissance art often combines realistic depictions of nature with spiritual or divine subjects.

characteristics.name: Idealized human forms
characteristics.description: Italian Renaissance artists aimed to depict the human body in an idealized, perfected way that reflects classical ideals of beauty.

characteristics.name: Balanced compositions
characteristics.description: The use of symmetry and proportion creates a sense of balance and harmony in Italian Renaissance works.

characteristics.name: Serene focus on divine symmetry and harmony
characteristics.description: Italian Renaissance art often conveys a sense of calm and order, reflecting the belief in a harmonious, divinely ordered universe.

characteristics.name: Soft brushstrokes
characteristics.description: Impressionist artists used loose, fluid brushstrokes to capture the fleeting effects of light and color.

characteristics.name: Dynamic lighting
characteristics.description: The play of light and shadow is a key element in Impressionist works, creating a sense of movement and atmosphere.

characteristics.name: Focus on capturing the emotional warmth and joy of communal faith
characteristics.description: Impressionist art often depicts scenes of everyday life with a sense of warmth and joy, celebrating the beauty of ordinary moments.

characteristics.name: Majestic compositions with idealized figures
characteristics.description: High Renaissance artists achieved a sense of grandeur and majesty in their works, often depicting idealized human forms.

characteristics.name: Focus on the grandeur of divine moments
characteristics.description: High Renaissance art frequently explores themes of divine beauty and spiritual significance.

characteristics.name: Unified compositions where each element contributes to the overall narrative or theme
characteristics.description: The careful arrangement of elements in High Renaissance works creates a cohesive and harmonious whole.

characteristics.name: Sweeping landscapes
characteristics.description: Romantic allegorical works often feature expansive, dramatic landscapes that evoke a sense of the sublime.

characteristics.name: Atmospheric lighting
characteristics.description: The use of light and shadow enhances the emotional impact of Romantic allegorical scenes.

characteristics.name: Symbolic representations
characteristics.description: Romantic allegory often uses symbolic figures and elements to convey deeper meanings and themes.

characteristics.name: Emphasizes the awe and grandeur of natural elements
characteristics.description: The Romantic sublime focuses on the power and majesty of nature, often depicting dramatic landscapes and natural phenomena.

characteristics.name: Spiritual undertones
characteristics.description: Many works in this style convey a sense of spiritual awe and reverence for the natural world.

characteristics.name: Dramatic contrasts
characteristics.description: The use of strong contrasts in light and color enhances the emotional impact of Romantic sublime works.

characteristics.name: Symmetry
characteristics.description: The Arts and Crafts Movement emphasizes balanced, symmetrical designs that reflect a sense of order and harmony.

characteristics.name: Natural motifs
characteristics.description: Artists in this movement frequently incorporated natural forms and patterns into their designs, celebrating the beauty of the natural world.

characteristics.name: Handcrafted quality
characteristics.description: The movement valued handcrafted work and traditional craftsmanship, often featuring intricate details and high-quality materials.
